intro: Vanda dives, commonly known as the golden vanda, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, pendant stems and clusters of showy, golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, relying on atmospheric moisture for nourishment. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native humid environment. Vanda dives is prized for its vibrant blooms and is a popular choice for indoor and greenhouse cultivation.
